证据片段: We have noticed an unusual pinkish oxide color, similar to that of clay, for all the specimens tested at 1705°C and in a mixture of hydrogen and steam with steam supply rates ≲0.3 g/min (Fig. 6).

证据片段: The composition of the oxide skin observed for the smallest steam supply rate in Fig. 10 corresponds to ZᵣO₀.₉₉₆H₀.₉₆₅, which is close to ZrOH.

文献ID: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_055_chunk5
证据片段: McClaine and Coppel [12] in their investigation of the electrical conductivity of tetragonal ZrO₂ at 1100 to 1550°C have reported increased electronic conductivity (hence, decreased ionic conductivity) in hydrogen-steam mixtures compared with similar measurements in carbon monoxide-carbon dioxide mixtures.
